column1: '''Professor Rashbold''' was a [[Man]] living in the [[wikipedia:20th century

Rashbold transliterated and translated the [[Edwin Lowdham]]'s manuscript on the behest of [[Michael George Ramer]]. The text was in [[Old English]] written in [[Tengwar]]. It described the [[Downfall of Númenor]].<ref name="Night"/>
He was described by [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham
column2: Lowdham]] as a "grumpy old bear".<ref name="Night">{{SD

column1: The name ''Rashbold'' is a pun on [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s own surname, being a translation from [[wikipedia:German language
